intro: [WRONG START] Asteleia forbesii subsp. nivea, commonly known as the silver astelia, is a perennial herb native to New Zealand. It features a rosette of silver-gray, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces tall, slender stems bearing small, white, bell-shaped flowers in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or coastal landscapes. Its striking foliage makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
